choices.text:
Write an email to my boss letting them know I am leaving the company
Subject: Notification of My Intention to Resign from the Company

Dear [Boss's Name],

I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to inform you that after much thought and consideration, I have decided to resign from my position at the company effective [resignation date].

I want to take this opportunity to express my gratitude for the opportunities and experiences I have had working here. I have learned so much and owe a lot of my professional growth to this company and its employees.

However, after careful consideration, I have decided that it is time for me to pursue new challenges and opportunities outside of the company. [Reason for leaving: personal or career-related reason].

I am committed to making sure that my departure is smooth and seamless for everyone at the company. I will work with my replacement, if one has been hired, to ensure a smooth transition of responsibilities. I will also make sure to document all of my processes and knowledge so that others can pick up where I left off.

[If applicable: "I would like to thank you for the support and guidance you have provided me during my time here. Your mentorship has been invaluable, and I am grateful for the opportunities you have given me."]

Please let me know if there is anything else I can do to help with the transition or any other matters before my last day. [Resignation date: at least two weeks' notice].

Again, I want to thank you and the entire team for all of their support and hard work. This has been a great place to work, and I will miss everyone here.

Sincerely,

[Your Name]
